<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Coughing Dragon Display](/Feats.aspx?ID=3246) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 134 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Archetype** [Fireworks Technician](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=119)

**Prerequisites**
[Firework Technician Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3245)

</column>

---

This display emits a cascade of loud bangs or glittering trails. While you initially designed the display to captivate your audience's attention, it turns out to have a surprisingly effective use in combat, suppressing auditory or visual effects behind your magnificent display. You gain the Coughing Dragon fireworks display.

 **Coughing Dragon** <actions string="Two Actions" /> **Cost** 1 fireworks display; **Effect** Choose either [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) or [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163) effects. The display gains that trait, and you attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) one or more effects within 60 feet that have this trait. On a success, the effect is suppressed until the start of your next turn, rather than ending entirely. Use your [Fireworks Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) modifier as your counteract modifier, and your counteract level is equal to half your level (rounded up). A coughing dragon costs 2 batches of infused reagents rather than 1, but you can increase the cost to 3 batches and spend an additional action to create an even bigger coughing dragon display that attempts to counteract both auditory and visual effects at the same time.
name: Coughing Dragon Display
